intro: Cacalia pauciflora, commonly known as the sparse-flowered bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Cacalia pauciflora is known for its modest flowering display and is often found in dry, sunny environments.
